Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Miami Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Simon V
Reviews.Content: When you need somewhere to retire to after all the hectic activities, nightlife (and traffic) of Miami, this is the ideal place in Coconut Grove. Neither too far from anywhere nor too close to be affected by any of it, the Grove Isle is a mini island paradise with superb views, great service, blissfully cool and comfortable rooms and a great bar/restaurant. Can't say enough good things bout our 3-night stay here as it really was idyllic after working for much of the day at a South Beach convention. A really unusual location and wonderful, calm retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: April V
Reviews.Content: Last week, my company had a meeting at Grove Isle for almost a week. The service was excellent: the wait staff knew my name, food and beverage preferences by heart after the first night and the event coordinator Megan was a joy to work with, very accommodating and exceptional with her willingness. Above all, the location is phenomenal. It's not often you get to wake up with a warm southern breeze blowing in through the balcony door while overlooking an ocean view. I also enjoyed an amazing deep tissue massage at the adjoining spa where, again, the staff was wonderful and attentive. Last but not least, my favorite aspect of the hotel and surrounding area is the .67 mile loop that goes around the property. I got to get my jog in each day without fearing for my life and while also enjoying a beautiful view.

Reviews.Title: “unprofessional, unpleasant stay, credit card issues”
Reviews.Author: Rinobear
Reviews.Content: a nightmare with my personal credit card, they charged an amount they were not supposed to, one week of lies telling they had solved straight away, explanation like "we can't send international faxes!!!" they pretend to be professional but they are not, I had to argue with acc. office, other bunch of lies, unbelievable...at the end I had to solve myself the issue, a place to avoid a total nightmare! besides everyone in my group had issues with bills, invoices...

Reviews.Title: “Good relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: vacationerFromNC
Reviews.Content: Have booked 4 out of 6 days of my Miami vacation at this place. It is a nice and calm place. It is like a tropical retreat in Miami. Nice laid back look and feel to it. It is set into the back of the bay and so is quiet and so also no beach action. Nice water front walkway and a really nice view from the restaurant. The camp fire is also a popular place with the guests. I haven't seen young families with kids here. It is a smaller establishment of approx 50 rooms. If you are looking for action at your door step this is not your hotel. Most of the balcony rooms have trees partially obstructing the view. The restaurant has limited choice on the menu It is close to attractions. This is a place to stay when you have your own ride. The valet is quick and efficient. Looks like it is a popular place with locals for their events....... Anniversaries, marriages, etc

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Get-a-way!”
Reviews.Author: PeachMacon_GA
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting, attentive staff, fantastic dinning! We had a perfect weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The Views are great”
Reviews.Author: ilre12345
Reviews.Content: Spent several days over Christmas at the Grove Isle Hotel & Spa. The rooms are spacious with great views of the bay. The bathrooms are small and a little dated. Service in the restaurant is slow. Spent time at the pool. The tiki bar staff is very friendly and accommodating. If you are looking for a private getaway, this is a hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive and didn't quite live up to our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Cathyccc
Reviews.Content: WE read lots of reviews and some were good while others were not. We were lead to believe that the hotel was on an exclusive Island...ummm...not quite as there are very large condominiums that also share this island with the hotel. For the price paid, there were a lot of things that could be improved for very little money. Our first clue should have been the check in staff who were not dressed in any special manner when compared to other 4 and 5 star hotels we have stayed in in North America and in Europe. There wasn't a thorough explanation of the property, a list of the amenities offered, or a map given of the outlying area. When we reached our room it was obvious that while it once must have been high end for it's time, it was in need of some refreshing as the door knobs were scratched and well worn, the patio furniture was dusty and in need of new cushions, the coffee table was dinged, scratched, and the rattan under the glass was faded and half of the color was scratched off. When we went to use the portable phone, the base unit appeared to work, but obviously no one had checked the phone itself as it no longer worked. Fortunately there was a table phone which was in working order. Upon checking the bathroom we were not impressed as the tub could have easily been re caulked (there was mold around the caulking) which would have made it look more presentable. The cabinet under the sink was cracked and in need of much repair. We decided to high tail it outside as the property itself was really quite inviting and kept well. I think that is probably where all of their money goes. WE sat upon the lovely lounge chairs overlooking the water on a small sandy man made beach. My husband ordered to glasses of wine for us and when he returned with the plastic wine glasses which were in need of washing he looked very annoyed. Hmmm, not only were we charged for the wine, but they automatically add in their own gratuity. $30.00 for two glasses of wine is a bit steep. Well, upon first sip of this wine which should have been amazing for the price charged I had the urge to spit it out. It was awful! Once we dared to force ourselves to try a few more sips, I had had it and returned it politely to the bar staff who appeared surprise by my complaint. He assured me he would bring us another wine to replace the one we truly did not care for. Once again we took our first sip, blech! It tasted the same as the original wine given to us in which case it was returned again and we were given two glasses of beer which now lowered our bar bill to $19.00. We just felt that something wasn't right which led us to steer away from their in house restaurant which also had very high prices. When we finally retired to our room for the night we thought about ordering a movie, but I'm sorry $18.00 dollars for a movie is ridiculous! We gave it a miss. By the end of one night stay we paid a hotel tax, a parking fee, a overly priced bar bill and our bill came to a whopping $ 460.00. We were more than disappointed and would never consider staying there again, which is a shame because with some tweaking the hotel could have been a much different experience.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!”
Reviews.Author: John7171
Reviews.Content: This is BY FAR the worst hotel that my husband and I have EVER been to...and we've stayed at Holiday in Express! The service is attrocious. I had to attempt to serve myself a drink after literally waiting for an hour for a refill and even at that extreme it took another 20 min! (inital drink orders took over 30 min and it was just soda...)...The food wasn't horrible but wasn't good either. The people there are rude, miserable, and extremely unprofessional. It took over 5 hrs for our room to be ready once we arrived. I realize they only have so much control over that but they can also be nice and welcoming about it...The craziest part was when we requested and were approved for late checkout and an extremely rude, cranky man started banging on our door in the morning and said he had 2 new guests waiting to get into the room. WHAT??? Kicking us out in the morning after we had to wait until 5 pm for our room?!? Then they also called us up asking us to leave...This was all BEFORE our approved checkout time. When I casually and very nicely mentioned this at checkout they just looked at me weird and didn't apologize...The elevators there are DISGUSTING. The grounds are OK...but not to the point where I'd ever want to hang around there by choice. The room was OK as well but not very clean. Had to pay abt $100 in parking and resort fees at checkout for 1 standard room. Would gladly stay at Holiday Inn Express again over this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Tennis and Spa Resort in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: aicwebmaster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love Coconut Grove almost as much as we love tennis, so we had to spend a few days here for a short getaway. The private island location is fantastic as we were just 10 minutes to the heart of the Grove and downtown Miami and just 15 minutes to South Beach. The tennis facilities are excellent though the scenery around the tennis center can be quit distracting. The staff at the tennis center is first class, very accommodating and ready to help. The suites at the hotel are quite large and comfortable for a stay of a week or less. The lack of in-room laundry facilities make stays of more than a week problematic, if you're a serious player. We enjoyed the dining facilities and food at the resort's outlets are very good. Watch out for room service, we ordered a pastry platter and coffee for breakfast one morning and the bill was over $40! The Internet access was great and we could connect anywhere in the resort, which is important to us because we run our businesses via the web. All in all, it was a very enjoyable getaway and we look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay”
Reviews.Author: malrooskee
Reviews.Content: Big shoutout to Nicole who took care of us so pleasently and made sure everything was easy and comfortable. Terrific views!!

Reviews.Title: “And relax...”
Reviews.Author: GeoffnLesley
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, received a warm welcome on arrival and this friendly and extremely helpful attitude continued throughout our stay. A beautiful setting on the sea front with a lovely walk round the island. The food was extremely good, I enjoyed the cocktail lesson in the bar and the resulting mojito. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything stolen from our room!”
Reviews.Author: TeddyL
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience. We went for a wedding, and when we came back to our room, we found someone pissing outside our room and also that someone had stolen valuables from the room. The front desk was extremely rude and the managers, Eric and Tom, are not helpful. They didnt care and were more concerned with their text messages. Management was very rude and still charged us for the room, which was adequate at best Stay away unless you want to overpay for a place that smell, is small, and they will steal your things!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, exceeded expectations even during rainy visit”
Reviews.Author: ZebraLD
Reviews.Content: I visited Miami during some of the worst flooding ever this past Halloween weekend. I took a quick stroll around the grounds upon arriving before the skies opened up, and I was incredibly impressed by the lush, well-manicured landscaping and tranquil atmosphere right outside bustling Miami. Crossing onto the private bridge, you truly felt like you were escaping and entering a bubble of paradise. After a long night partying, I fell fast asleep on the deliciously comfortable bed. I woke up to enjoy breakfast on my veranda one morning, and downstairs overlooking the bay another morning. My only complaint was the crappy weather I experienced during my stay, because I did not get to enjoy all the beautiful outdoor space this resort has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “The overall management of this hotel is very poor”
Reviews.Author: Runnsun1
Reviews.Content: Sadly, my boyfriend and I were very disappointed with this hotel. I took him there as a surprise for his birthday for 2 nights and i wish i would have taken him somewhere else! Before I get into the negatives and why we won't return, I will give credit where it is due. 1. The food at the restaurant (Gibraltar) is Outstanding! We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner...thank goodness as it is very pricey! 5 star prices, 5 star food, good wine list, and well trained wait staff. The young gentleman who took care of us communicated with us as though he's been in the fine dining business for 20 years and didn't look a day over 18. 2. The spa was great! Not only was their communication prior to me arriving pleasant, but we loved our massages and facials and everyone there was very helpful and professional. I would recommend a visit to the spa. Besides a dinner or spa visit, I would steer clear of this hotel for the following reasons(some reasons are minor, some major, but overall u expect much better service from a hotel like this). When we checked in,the valet was too busy playing on his phone and almost seemed confused about helping with a cart for our bags. My first thought..."odd, oh well, maybe he's new"). Next was check in. I purchased a romance package with spa services, valet, breakfast, best suite they have, a specific bottle of wine, etc. I did this after thoroughly researching everything and deciding that the value of the wine(we like wine and this was a good bottle) and the deal on spa services made it a decent package. I called before we arrived to ensure everything was set with the reservation and especially to verify the wine would be in the room, and I was assured all was according to plan. At the front desk, the young gentleman who checked us in said nothing of what is included in the package, of our reservations for services the next day at the spa, of our breakfast that's included, the drink coupons, etc. I again found this odd, as I've never checked into a hotel and not had them guide me along or verify these things or chat about all the great benefits I'm about to receive with my reservation. When we got to the room is where it really started to get bad. First of all, the bathroom grossed me out. The tub was so stained and dingy an the bidet was falling off the wall due to rust and mold all around it on the wall. And this is an expensive suite we are staying in! I called sown to change rooms and they didn't have any. When I looked to pour us a glass of nice red wine, all I found was cheap champagne. I called down and he said they put "house champagne" in as a substitute. I went down amd asked for a manager...no manager on duty! It's 7:30 pm...are u kidding me? So they get the restaurant manager, who was a very nice guy, but obviously didn't listen to what I was telling him, because then he sends up the wrong wine again. He sent up a substitute red that not only is worth half the value of the wine reserved with the package that we were supposed to get and I specifically asked hom for, but it wasn't very good. Either they try to trick people and hope they don't know any better or they are extremely pooy managed and either one doesn't sit well with me. So we didn't drink the Cabernet they sent up and ordered and paid for a good bottle at dinner in their restaurant. We would have anyway, but it's the principle. As a woman, I woke up in the middle of the night with a surprise and didn't have the womanly things I needed for this moment. I went to the desk to ask for emergency supplies...what do u think....no! Not only did they have nothing to get me through till the morning, but he acted like this is normal, not like thy ran out. They don't think of these things and don't have an on site store so I was left to drive 5 minutes to a gas station in a strange area in the dark. Before ordering breakfast, I asked the desk how I know what I am allowed to order from room service according to the package and he said it is listed on the menu in room. It wasn't, so we ordered what we wanted. They gave is no certificates or coupons or info on it. You will see why happened at check out below that relates to this... So we go to check out, and it was a fiasco! My boyfriend insisted on paying so I went to get the car from valet. Thank goodness I went to check on him because he almost payed a few hundred dollars more than he should have and he wouldn't have even known since I booked everything. They charged him for the full breakfast (no break for worth of continetal) valet for both nights, and the couples massage....all of which were included in the price of my package! When I checked the bill and got upset (and embarresed that I brought him to such a disorganized mismanaged place) the girl at the desk took off the valet and massages but again no break on breakfast. At this point I am exhausted from dealing with this place, and a man steps from the back and says he represents the corporate office and he's just visiting and apologizes and has her fix the breakfast. That's all? So it took me 20 minutes to check out to only end up at what we were originally owed based on our reservation....and acting like thy did is a favor by fixing it? Let's not forget the $100 value of wine in the package we never got. And we spent over $300 on dinner and tons of money in the spa on extra services and skin products. This place is a joke! I am a business professional that travels often and my career is based on customer service. This hotel has terrible customer service and management.

Reviews.Title: “One bad apple...”
Reviews.Author: J-Luv81
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful and staff service was exceptional except Ms. Goudie the front desk manager. I was assessed a hold of $480 on my card but was not informed of this until I went to check my bank account and found out I was in overdraft status. When I tried to resolve the issue with Ms. Goudie she was combative and had a nasty attitude. After making a multitude of excuses to my financial institution she finally agreed reduce the amount of the hold that was on my card since I told her I had never experienced this at the Intercontinential and other high-end hotels I've stayed at. She needs to stay behind a desk and never interact with the public with an attitude like that!!! The rest of the staff was great and eagerly would go beyond the call of duty to make sure the stay was pleasant. While eating breakfast outside on the patio area my friend was fanning herself because she had gotten overheated. One of the restaurant staff members actually came over and plugged up a fan for us! We didn't have to ask and didn't even think about asking since we were sitting in the outside patio dinning area. We had a couple of instances like this and it pleased me everytime. I just wish I had never encountered Ms. Goudie because then I would be blabbing nonstop about what a great value the hotel is rather than wishing I never went to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Daspudlz
Reviews.Content: I discovered Grove Isle Hotel through a Living Social deal. The hotel is beautiful, tucked away among perfectly-manicured palm trees and with breathtaking views of the bay. We spent a marvelous, relaxing three days celebrating my boyfriend's birthday. Each morning weâ€™d walk around the island passing the boats in the marina; we spent the rest of the time lolling around the pool and the hot tub, boat drinks in hand. It was such a nice change of pace from the craziness, lackluster service and so-so food generally found in South Beach, where we live. Grove Isleâ€™s restaurant, Gibraltar, was gorgeous, with food so well-prepared and innovative we ate at the hotel all three days. The filet mignon was fantastic and the spicy pickled quail eggs on the beef Carpaccio appetizer were an unexpected treat. Private, tucked away waterfront tables for two outside with candles and tiki torches made dinner truly memorable. We also ate at the bar, pairing a unique red wine with the chefâ€™s fantastic burgers. In short, this hotel is absolutely perfect for a romantic, quiet getaway. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa A
Reviews.Content: The service was good, atmosphere was amazing. HOWEVER, I got the package through livingsocial.com which was $375 for 3 nights making it $125/night. I am not sure how much rates are normally but I would assume significantly higher. I would say my stay was worth what I paid. We went to Miami to party for the most part and next time will stay on South Beach instead of Coconut Grove. If you're looking for quiet and romantic, it's the place to be. I enjoyed my stay very much overall!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Sloppy Service”
Reviews.Author: FLProf
Reviews.Content: Went to Coconut Grove to celebrate a friend's birthday at this boutique hotel. While the location is private and very beautiful I left feeling like I did not get my monies worth. I first noticed there was an issue with the service when I called to get information about local attractions the day before my arrival. The person at the desk told me I could "Google" the information. While she was correct I wanted to know what the local residents recommend. The second issue I encountered was requesting a cab to pick me up for dinner. I scheduled it through the front desk earlier in the day for an 8:10pm pick up. A cab arrived 20 minutes later than the time scheduled and I was late for my dinner reservation. Now I would say that had more to do with the cab service than the hotel but it turns out I received a call the next morning at 8:10 am indicating my cab had arrived. Ooops! Too late. They desk made the cab reservation for the wrong time. One of the really nice things about this hotel is that they are pet friendly. Unfortunately, my dog got ill in her pet carry and I needed to clean it out. I stopped one of the cleaning staff, explained the situation, and asked for some disinfectant to be brought to my room. The staff member said she would bring me disinfectant spray but never came back. I waited over an hour. The kicker of the entire experience occurred my last day when called room service to bring up 4 towels. I waited more than 30 minutes and called back to the desk indicating I still did not receive them. After waiting another 30 minutes I received 2 towels, not 4 as requested. This is not the type of service I expect from a 5 star hotel. On the positive side, the pool bar staff (Richard and Sebastian) were very attentive and helpful. Additionally, the 80 minute massage was very relaxing and I highly recommend it. However, if I had to do it again I would stay at a hotel more centrally located in Coconut Grove. For me, poor service indicates you do not want my business.

Reviews.Title: “Grove Isle is a special retreat!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy L
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a girl's weekend to celebrate my 50th birthday and had a wonderful experience at Grove Isle. The setting is beautiful, but the staff makes this place really special. From the front desk to the hosekeeping staff, they anticipated our needs and took excellent care of us. I will definitely be returning to this hotel and it's a great couples getaway spot.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some improving!!”
Reviews.Author: nugenthorneHitchin
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and our room was ready which was great. The first thoughts on the room was great, but we had to ring down to reception to have all the alcohol which was in a cupboard (amounting over $1,000) removed from our room, as the cupboard was at our 19 month old daughters height and i didn't fancy picking up the bill for this. The cupboard was full of dust and god knows how long the drink had been there! The shower in the bathroom was terrible, no pressure at all and an old fashioned TV mounted on the wall. The rooms in general were very tired and needed updating. The view from the balcony was fantastic, which probably saved the day with the room. There was no kids menu supplied, which i found quite shocking from such a hotel, so i had to fight for an omelette to be cooked for my daughters dinner, then realised we had been charged $20!!! Which is outragious!! THe concept of the hotel is lovely and the views are breath taking, though not sure the actual hotel lives up to the reputation! It needs some monrey spent on it to update it!!

Reviews.Title: “A great kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: sharon s
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 3 night get-a-away package from Living Social and it was better than I could have imagined..The hotel is very private, the staff extremely pleasant and the setting was just beautiful..We enjoyed the spa services as well as the delicious food served in the restaurant.It is going to be one of our new found places to just "get-away".

Reviews.Title: “Words cannot describe how Beautiful this hotel is”
Reviews.Author: Kevin N
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. I stayed her off of a Living Social deal. When I got to the hotel I was very excited being my first time in FL and all. When I walked into the lobby I could see straight thru the double doors to the bay. I felt like I was on an exotic Island. I went to check in and was told that my room with the Bay View was sold out. It was disappointing at first until the young lady at the counter called the front desk supervisor Nicole to help me. I instantly thought my experience was going to be a bad one until Nicole said we are very sorry sir but I am going to take care of you. And boy did she. Nicole upgraded me to another suite that was out of this world. I walked into this room and could see straight thru the double doors out to the bay. This room was absolutely Gorgeous from the marble floors thru out to the shower with body jets, and a glass sink in the bathroom. It took me 5 min just to figure out how to turn the sink on it was so modern.That room looked like something on the Divine Design show. I was waiting for Candice Olson to give me a personal tour. I thought I had died and went to heaven. I woke up the next morning to the most Beautiful sunrise off the water while laying in my bed. I felt like Scarface. The only thing that was missing was my own private yacht out front. That evening I sat on the patio and watched the sunset and the moon rise. The next day as I walked the halls I ran into Nicole and she remembered my first and last name. In fact half the staff remembered. They made me feel like a celebrity. I had to ask if they thought I was the way they treated me. They said no they didn't and that was just how they value there customers. Well I felt like one anyway the whole weekend. I went out to a comedy show came back and even the valet attendant remembered my name. This is indeed to me a 5 star hotel. I live in Las Vegas and know all to well what a 5 star hotel is and this hotel is at the top of my list. For the money this hotel is a hidden treasure, So much so I started not to write about my stay because I don't want to many people asking about my private room. I don't want it to be sold out when I go back again. They should name it the Vegas Suite. Anyone that does not believe how Beautiful this room is tell Nicole Kevin sent you and you want the same room she gave me. Men I promise you if you bring your lady she will not want to leave this room the whole weekend, and once you get on this private Island I think that would be the idea if you know what I mean. All I ask is that you name your first born after me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Beautiful Hotel/Resort.”
Reviews.Author: tewkewl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a living social special... and wow. it was fabulous. The grounds are more like a resort than simply a hotel. To start, the hotel is on a private gated island that is accessible by a bridge from coconut grove. There is a long walking path circling the island with beautiful trees, views of the water, and even a tiny private beach! There are outdoor "rooms" all over the resort, with firepits, chairs and sofas, and amazing views. The pool area includes a poolside bar and an amazing view of the bay. The dining was also top notch. we had continental breakfasts included every day, and was very happy with both the food and the service. We also had lunch there and I have to say that the presentation was excellent as well. At night, the restaurant transforms into a posh jacket and dress type establishment with a nice bar, music, and a romantic view of the bay. We were too busy out in miami beach to have dinner there, but we hope to try it next time. The restaurant staff also provided some great off resort recommendations for dining (we went to The Forge, and it was really posh and hip at the same time). The rooms are also nice and spacious with tile floors, a european style bathroom (with bidet), and balconies overlooking the water. There was a 42 inch TV in our room as well. Our room also included a separate seating area. We will most definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Casual elegance, what a pleasant change of pace from the national chains.”
Reviews.Author: martkarina
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful weekend get-a-way. Just a two minute drive from activities in beautiful Coconut Grove Florida lies this romantic, elegant yet casual gem of a hotel. Situated on what appears to be a little island a couple hundred feet from the mainland (don't worry, a small bridge will help you not get wet). One you arrive you'll immediately feel like you're in a boutique hotel in Bali or some other exotic island. The room was spacious, beautifully decorated and incredibly comfortable with a relaxing view of the Bay. We really loved the outdoor evening dinning. Many of the outdoor tables for two or four were located at multiple levels between the main outdoor dinning area and the water. Little walkways and decks transported you to these alcove dinning spots. Another of our favorites were comfortable outdoor chairs clustered around constantly burning fire pits. Though a little warm to spend much time at the fire pit in August in summer, this must be a great place to relax in the Fall and Winter. If you're looking for a romantic get-a-way to spend time relaxing away from the hustle and bustle of Miami, we highly recommend a visit to Grove Isle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place for a Quiet Getaway”
Reviews.Author: SWFloridaTeri
Reviews.Content: This resort is the perfect spot for a quiet get away. I wanted to get the Miami experience without the party feel of South Beach. This resort is beautiful, quiet, romantic .. I could have spent the whole time lounging in one of the chairs placed waterside with the sea breeze blowing over my body. The location gives you easy acess to Coconut grove and the wanderful dining experiences there and also a small easy commute to get to So. Beach if you want to shake it up. The staff anticipates your needs and the stay is easy, hassel free and you actually feel pampered while you are there. I am from southwest florida, I will definitely stay here on my next visit to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time in our South Florida Backyard!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin R
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful get away in our back yard of South Florida. We brought our two children and our new puppy and everyone had a blast. The deals this time of year are incredible. The place was luxurious, the amenities on site was great from tennis to spa and pool. The food was delicious. I especially want to recognize the great service we got from Nicole at the front desk and the staff on the premises. The place is very dog friendly and it made it very easy for our new puppy to adjust.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Quiet & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Carmen050
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel because there was a special offer which I took advantage of. I was very surprised how peaceful this location was. Even though it's not by the ocean it's by the bay and it is great to just sit have a drink and relax. Time simply stops and you don't know what time it is. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. You even have a small TV in the bathroom. It's a very small hotel with only 50 rooms, so there is not that multitude of people of the larger hotels which I really enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location - ideal weekend gateway”
Reviews.Author: Verely
Reviews.Content: A vacation from South Beach into a carefully landscaped tropical hide-out, this is what the Grove Isle hotel is all about. Nicely tucked at the end of this way too geometrical island; the Grove Isle hotel gets you to breath at your own pace.Â  The small enough size (50 rooms) is perfect for those who want a good balance between humanity and 'me & my book' quite time. The view from the top floor makes the location a superb sunrise camera-ready-shoot spot.Â  The staff seems genuinely interested in adding a personal touch but could get a little more efficient - well, slowness also goes with taking a vacation from the ordinary I guess.Â  It's pet friendly - which is a plus if you have your own pet but it's a SIGNIFICANT DETERRENT if your neighbors left theirs in the room crying for over 4 hours. Poor furry guest... Also not great if the hotel does not allow you to avoid the heartbreaking crying - despite a request of changing room. I am a pet parent too, but in managing this the hotel fell really short.Â  The pool is not a plus but having the beach chairs conveniently located few feet from the Biscayne Bay makes up for it.Â  All and all, the location makes you to be thankful to be here.Â

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: BarbAnderson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Miami to move our daughter down here. Wonderful place but we did encounter a couple of problems; the main one being that our TV did not work. We arrived on Sunday and checked out Wed. We called 3 times to the front desk with no results. As we were relaxing by the pool/bar Tuesday afternoon we mentioned to Renee the bartender...who by the way is awesome!!! She said the engineering people were on the property and would see what she could do. It was fixed...basically just hours before we were to leave. We also experienced a little snafu with our A/C in the room. I called the front desk and was put on hold.....she never came back and I had to call again. Someone did come up and rectify the problem. The other little issue that I noticed was when housekeeping came the first time on Monday, they did not leave anymore toilet paper or toiletries. I had to call and have those delivered. In conclusion, except for the TV debacle the other things were minor that i can pretty much overlook and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What a paradise!”
Reviews.Author: clouise87
Reviews.Content: We came down in the begining of July with our two children for four days & what a paradise we came across! Great staff, excellent spa we got to get away to with no children, excellent restaurant, and great pool with an ocean view. We hope to return very soon! Thank you to all the staff for such an excellent stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: slindax
Reviews.Content: This property is fabulous!!! located in coconut grove and close to all that Miami has to offer...yet when you "turn in" you leave the crowds, noise, & traffic behind...and retreat to an island oasis with beautifully appointed rooms & a lush tropical pool! The ultimate Miami hotel for service, serenity, & luxury!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in the world, favorite place!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl150
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Grove Isle, it was another amazing stay! I loved my room, loved the service and cannot say enough good things about the property. From the minute I arrived until the minute I departed the trip was amazing. I took advantage of the Miami Spa Month and enjoyed a great massage with Patty, not only was the massage amazing but Patty was a lovely person, really a treat to talk with. The whole spa staff could not have been nicer as well as every other department at the Hotel. I am already looking for time to come on a return trip. I travel a lot and work for a very high end hotel group, Grove Isle is first class and I love everything about it. Keep up the good work, the smiling faces like Nicole, Felipe and of course Patty make Grove Isle a special place. Thank you for making a 2 days business trip very pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever-I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: cocoajohnny
Reviews.Content: On a recent business trip I had the pleasure of visiting for 3 nights while in Coconut Grove, Miami.The Resort offers all the amenities plus...5 star service! Eric Hyde the GM and staff were fantastic and I highly recommend for your next family or business visit. The private Island Hotel is very convenient to downtown Miami, Cruise ships and my favorite South Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Accomodations! Total Relaxation Spa and Wonderful Food!”
Reviews.Author: jackster07
Reviews.Content: So close to Miami, but off the beaten path in luxurous Coconut Grove; Grove Isle is beautifully positioined on a private island with gentle breezes from the bay! The staff are extremely welcoming. Don't miss the Lobster Cobb Salad offered at Gibraltar and also at the Pool Bar. Other luxuries of the resort include a beautiful pool and many tennis courts manned by tennis pros. My accomodations have an amazing bed that overlooked the bay! The Spa offers so many types of treatments, that I'm looking forward to returning, I did indulge in several services.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings, there's some inconsistency”
Reviews.Author: farrlynn
Reviews.Content: I want to disclose that I did not actually stay overnight in this hotel. I was supposed to stay here for a wedding that was held at the hotel, but sadly there was a problem with my reservation so I ended up sleeping somewhere else. I did spend a considerable amount of time at this hotel because my mother was staying at the hotel and I also attended the wedding that was held here. The wedding was amazing and executed almost perfectly. Aside from the barking dog and loud children that were allowed to carry on while the ceremony was going on. The location is beautiful, but the rooms are a bit dated and the service is inconsistent especially at the bar for a hotel that was at capacity service was very slow especially for a four star hotel. The breakfast however was delicious. The pool was not as clean as I would have liked. There were some staff members who really went the extra mile whereas others barely made an effort.I was also unhappy with an interaction I had with one of the managers, I had an issue that needed to be resolved and coming to a reasonable resolution was like pulling teeth. I think that this hotel has great potential, but has some kinks to iron out.

Reviews.Title: “Never go back again!”
Reviews.Author: shoeprinces
Reviews.Content: I made my reservations months in advance for a family wedding, I had two rooms reserved and paid for. The day we arrived they bumbed us out of the hotel and a sais they had a large amount of rooms with plumbing problems. We had to stay a few miles away from everyone, they felt they did not owe us anything since they arranged us to move to another hotel. The hotel was very basic. We missed out on alot of the activities and were unable to drink due to the fat we had to drive away from the hotel. The bartenders were not very nice in the bar at the Grove Isle. No microphone for the wedding, we could not here the ceremony. Very disappointing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VACATION”
Reviews.Author: Dpkai65
Reviews.Content: I don't believe that we were just fortunate that our 4 night stay (5/22 - 5/26) was a great vacation at Grove Isle. I honestly feel that any negatives I could mention in this review were merely things beyond the staff's control. Everything was as advertised and we had exactly the room that we reserved. The location is great. The staff was friendly and attentive. We did not have any real complaints to test the staff's ability to handle unhappy customers and did not witness any disgruntled guests. The one problem we did have was that we were not able to receive an internet signal in our room for the last 2 days of our stay. Oddly enough, we could get a signal down at the pool just not in our room. We called the front desk and they said that the internet was working and no one else had complained of this. I do believe that if we had pressed the issue they would have done whatever they could to try to help us with our problem. The time we were there is their off season and found the hotel very quite and empty. Had the pool all to ourselves most of the time. A short drive away we were able to find all the people, noise, and activity you could want from downtown Miami. Eventhough we were there during two NBA games and there was some light construction it was only 10 - 15 minutes to Downtown or South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!!!!!!!!!!!!! A Must at least once in your lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Latonia421
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 days and 4 nites May 18-22, 2011...Beautiful place to stay..can't find nothing bad to say...food was great...Richard at the Tiki Bar was a real treat...all the staff was amazing..the manager was so gracious to us....loved all the personal touches...will definately stay there everytime I am in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Tripadvisor ranking suggests...”
Reviews.Author: h0d
Reviews.Content: Grove Isle is a great place to stay, the hotel grounds are really lovely and attentively looked after and the waterfront location is superb from an early morning jog right through to a relaxing drink by the fire late in the evening. Pros: Large rooms, nice decor, individuality of the place, food at Gibraltar, security offered by private gated complex, plenty of pool beds available especially in the week, the running track around the island Cons: Food and drink are a bit pricey (although that could be that my Â£'s are still worth rather less than they used to be), it's a drive to go anywhere else and cabs aren't always easy to come by Be aware: The resort facilities are shared with condo residents and the self park (if you want to avoid $25 a day just to park your car) is right at the other end of the island.

Reviews.Title: “The Spa Ruined My First Year Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: avidales
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are busy bee's. On Saturdays she works and I attend an executive MBA program. It is difficult for us to travel for multiple nights but we live in Miami and I decided to surprise her for our first wedding anniversary with a one night stay, dinner at the Gibraltar (the hotel restaurant), and the cherry on top a romantic spa session. I checked in on Saturday and the rooms were a bit old but clean and a nice view. The restaurant, Gibraltar was great. The hotel and restaurant knew we were celebrating a special occasion and the host gave us the table alongside the bay. It was a beautiful and amazing view. The next day I had planned a 1:30pm spa session for us both and reserved the "Watsu" pool for 45 minutes after. They called it the "romance" package and I reserved it a week in advance. When we arrived we were escorted to the relaxation room and left to wait for about 15 minutes. Next we were told by the spa receptionist that we had to choose which one of us two were going to get the massage because they only had one therapist??? I immediately replied it was unacceptable considering I had called a week in advance and I specifically told them it was my first wedding anniversary. She then told me I could always just reschedule. This is my first marriage and I am not that experienced in this field but I do know rescheduling a wedding anniversary is not a good idea or feasible. I then walked out and immediately went to the lobby and asked for the hotel manager. I was expecting a more sensitive, understanding, and helpful individual. Instead I dealt with a manager who told me they had no control over not having sufficient therapist. I was disgusted as there was a lack of compassion and above all a resolution to please a client. What can you expect from a staff that is lead by this type of individual? Overall I will NEVER go there again. I couldn't believe they ruined my first wedding anniversary. Fortunately, I have a loving wife and she was just pleased with my attempt to make it a memorable time. However I am not pleased with the hotel spa's lack of customer service oriented individuals. Its not like they are charging Motel 6 prices. I wouldn't recommend staying here, but I wouldn't discourage anyone from having dinner at Gibraltar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: debbieay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had a long weekend stay - it was our 2nd or 3rd time at the Grove. Perfect spot if you love to play tennis (we don't) and wonderful walking trail around the water/property if you like to walk (we do). We arrived at noon on Friday and our room was ready. The room itself is quite large by hotel standards, and we had a lovely balcony as well. Bar area by the pool, terrific bar inside, very large restaurant and nice fitness room - all of which overlook the water- great views! The location is secluded, so it is nice to have a car - we were minutes away from downtown Coconut Grove and not much further to go to South Beach. Go for the relaxation and beautiful location, enjoy drinks at the bar and take advantage of the firepit / tiki lights at night, while enjoying the water view. Be sure to go to Bouchon du Grove - a french restaurant in Coconut Grove where the waitors are also french and the food is excellent (we had a french couple dining beside us so you know the place is good). Make reservations. We plan to return to the Grove Isle next time we are in the area - can't imagine anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: newtravels43
Reviews.Content: I had a really good time on my trip to Miami, and especially at Grove Isle. It was my first time there and I've traveled all over the US, I can't believe I've been missing out this long. The hotel is on an island and has incredible views, and the staff is incredible too, especially Jose at the front desk. He assisted me in the hotel, gave me tips on where to go and where to eat other than the restaurant on site which is great. I would definitely return to Grove Isle with my wife next time, I think she'd love it just as much as I did. I just hope that Jose is still at the property when I come back, what a big difference a good staff makes! This place is great for people who come to see The Sony Erickson since it's only 10 minutes away. Thanks again, see you guys soon!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST STAY EVER..HORRIBLE!!”
Reviews.Author: tral100
Reviews.Content: Seeing how my company recomemded this hotel i gave it a try.Problems began upon check in at the hotel after completing my check in i asked for an extra key to have 2 but was denied because the hotel ran out of keys!!. I could not believe it..from there i had a feeling this would be a bad experience.The room was ok, needs to be updated and smelled musty but a very nice view of the bay. Wanted room service but cordless phone did not work,took 3 phone calls to get room service.The sheets of the bed were old and the top sheet had a tear, I asked for extra towels and was told to please wait about an hour because they are drying,This was all on the first night.for my second and last night after return of my business meeting i passed by the front desk for the business center and what a joke of a business center!! Its a hole no bigger than a cubicle with a phone that does not work and a huge printer with no toner that takes up the space of the desk and no AC. If you wanted AC the door has to be opened to get it from outside,by the way the business center is next to the bathrooms.But the worst is the ridiculos and rotten way to steal money. Upon check out i noticed they have a resort fee it was $25 per night! I asked as to what was covered on this fee. I was told pool service,business center usage,turndown service and the free wi-fi service. I checked out the pool and it was dirty,no towels for guest and leaves and bugs in the pool and outside the pool.Turndown consist of opening the bed,ice and one towel.How is the wi-fi free if theres a fee for it?? I asked the supervisor nicole and instead of apologizing for all the inconvenienced i encountered she was very confrontive towards the matter and really had the poor attitude of i dont care. I asked for her business card and of course she had none, but was very open to give me the general managers card, i have never meet someone so fake.for the rate of $329 a night please go to the ritz,four seasons,mandarin,conrad,viceroy or even a motel 8, i know you will get much better service from them..

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS”
Reviews.Author: trudysmom666
Reviews.Content: You will feel like you are on a tropical island & yet Miami is at your front door. We had a great stay. The pool was so relaxing. The restaurant wonderful. the whole experience was soooo romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: jackii329
Reviews.Content: My bad experience with this hotel started from even before I got there. I had actually been considering using this hotel for a future wedding. I had requested some information on the spa and was speaking to a representative through Email about the services. After I was ready to book the appointment, the spa representative asked me to submit my credit card number, CV code and expiration date through Email. Seeing as this completely unprofessional, risky, and I believe can be illegal coming from the Spa, I decided to write back to the rep. and tell her that I felt very insecure about doing this through Emai and if they could just use the credit card that the hotel had on file because I would be staying the weekend at the hotell. The lady told me that because I felt unsure about sending her my credit card information (through Email) I could call them, but she would need the information in order to book the appointment because the spa and hotel ran on a different payment system. After seeing how unprofessional they were and a little nervous about even giving them my credit card, period, I decided not to call and continue the booking of the appointment. On the day of check-in I received a voicemail where the spa was calling to confirm my appointment. I was a little bit confused since I had not actually booked the services because I had not given my credit card information. I called the hotel, and after being transferred three different times, I finally spoke to the poorly trained in customer service spa representative. Apparently, the spa representative that I had spoken to through Email had just assumed that she should go ahead and book the services, which came out to almost $300. I explained to the representative over the phone that because I was told that a credit card was needed in order to continue the booking, I did not understand why my services were booked and I was not even sent an Email confirming the services. Then she continued to tell me that because I did not cancel ahead that I would be charged for the services anyway and that because I had a credit card on the hotel, now (suddenly) they were able to use that credit card. After much discussion with this representative (who should not even be allowed to speak to customers) she told me that she would cancel the services and just hung up on me before I could make sure there would be no charges. Before this incident, I had seriously thought about booking a spa appointment IN PERSON, but after that experience, I will neither go nor recommend it to even my worst enemy. You do not assume to charge somebody almost $300 worth of spa services and then fail to send them a confirmation. I work in the business profession and I was appalled at the horrible customer service I experienced. If the spa hadn't been enough, after our stay I went downstairs to check out and review my folio because I had noticed a strange $100 charge. I asked the receptionist and she shrugged and told me it was an amenity charge. I explained to her that I know that I had ordered champagne and strawberries for the room, but I requested them for $50 as it says on their reservation page on the internet. With a ridiculous amount of attitude, she said that they were $75 plus tax. At this point I was already fed up with the customer service that I told her that when I requested it online, it said it was $50 and I was paying no more than that (plus tax and service charge). She finally credited the difference to my account, but there was absolutely no sympathy or apology for any of their mistakes. The rooms were very nice and the island is beautiful to walk around and take in the scenery, but for the type of experience I had with the (I can't find a bad enough word for this) poorly trained employees. I will never recommend or stay at this hotel ever again. For the amount of money you pay a night, and after adding amenities, it is no where near worth it. I expected to have a carefree and relaxing Valentine's Day weekend, and I experienced the most stressful and aggravating stay of my life. The only people who were pleasant were the valet staff and the servers at the restaurant, tips, of course. There's nothing more that I can say except to stay away from this hotel and spa. It will soon run itself down with the stench that is its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice but not as quiet as thought”
Reviews.Author: Equitrade
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this very nice hotel for 2 nights and enjoyed it quite well. What disturbed us very much was the very old air conditioners that make a lot of noise and made it impossible for us to sleep through - it was impossible to switch it off unfortunately and the helpful staff could not do anything about it - however they reiumbursed to us the very expensive parking fee which was an effort. The gym is very nice and sophisticated but the spa looks to us like the most expensive spa that we have been to all over the world....

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarMourinho
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at first time in 2006 and we came back again. The rooms are great but you have to pic one with sea view. They are a bit tropical design so you have to like this kind of decoration. The pool area it's amazing and has a great jacuzzi. The restaurant is amazing too, but there are no meals included in your stay. By night there are big fireplaces outside where you can seet for a chat and a cup of wine. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay/ excellent service”
Reviews.Author: debbieclopton
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was outstanding....Rooms clean and comfortable. Food and Beverage outlets were wonderful....dinner was excellent, food was great along with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: xosunshine39
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled with some friends to Grove Isle. We were told this hotel was the best of the best and it was. The wonderful service not only started once you stepped foot on the island but as you left to go home. The restaurant and food was absolutely delicious and gorgeous. The staff was helpful in every way possible, including giving us tips of places to visit with directions of course. I could not even begin to explain how much we enjoyed this trip. I highly encourage everyone and anyone to visit and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect tropical wedding destination resort in Miami”
Reviews.Author: smkluck
Reviews.Content: The new renovations at Grove Isle Resort are amazing! We got married in April 2010 (65ppl) and everyone who attended and/or stayed at the Resort were blown away by the food, views, location and especially the new staff/service. This little hidden gem is Miami's best spot for a secluded outdoor wedding that is away from it all, but still right in the middle of everything you go to Miami for. While I would love to name each and every staff member that shined, it would take too long. Starting from the time you arrive at valet, to the day you check out the GM should be proud of the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “An Indulgent Celebration”
Reviews.Author: trigirlflorida
Reviews.Content: I took a friend of mine to celebrate a milestone birthday-a girls spa weekend. The special pricing they had for the summer was exceptional. Check-in was a breeze and they were able to accomodate our early arrival. Spa services were exquisite. The rooms are spacious and the views sublime. The staff couldn't have been more attentive. The robes that are provided in the spa and the room are getting a little "tired". We didn't have dinner at the restaurant on site-but breakfast was typical resort fare. Having read previous reviews regarding the bill I was on guard-and there were some discrepencies. They were unable to correct them at check-out but within 2 days things were straightened out. I would return to this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like an outsider...”
Reviews.Author: RastaRan
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I recently took a weekender to this hotel. Upon arrival, gate guard looked at us like we were lost. My friend and I are 24 and 25--so considering most guests are well over 30, we didn't look like we were in the right place. Once at the front of the hotel the valet guys were SUPER friendly and very welcoming. The service stopped there. Once inside, I met "Christina" at the front desk. My friend and I were in jeans and flip flops in a hotel where people are totally dressed up all the time. She gave us terrible looks and an accompanying attitude. "Yes?" she said to us. I told her we had reservations, she asked for a card, then gave us the room key and told us where the room was. That's it. For the price we paid a night, you'd expect a better attitude. Restaurant staff was super friendly--housekeeping, exceptional. It's the front desk people who looked down at us as if we didn't belong to some exclusive club bc we walked around in casual clothes--despite the fact that we spend $800 on service and food alone. --WATCH OUT: the hotel automatically adds 20% gratuity to EVERYTHING already. All in all, nice place...but if you don't "look" the part....they'll treat you like it.

Reviews.Title: “ruined mother's day”
Reviews.Author: sue111111
Reviews.Content: I was planning a surprise for my mother and made reservations for a massage followed by brunch. Upon arrival I was informed that I did not have a reservation. My credit card information was most certainly there in the computer, but the employee that I spoke with never booked the reservation. I don't know where the manager was on this holiday, but we heard nothing during the two hour wait we had before we could be seated for brunch. While we ere eating, the manager (who could not be bothered to speak to us directly) sent a girl out to let us know they could "fit her in" after lunch. We declined since we had somewhere else to go and told the girl that he had all of our contact information and to please have him contact us. I have heard nothing from him. Also, don't bother with the brunch. For the same exact price, the Biltmore is one thousand times better in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelAsh_10
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a wedding at the Grove Isle hotel, and stayed there for a long weekend. Yes, it was expensive, but so is the rest of Miami, and I have to say I thought it was truly lovely and I had a great time. Restaurant: DELICIOUS. My boyfriend actually said "I don't know when I'll have another steak like that". The chef is originally from NYC and worked as Donald Trump's personal chef for a while. It is also designed beautifully. It's all glass and wood paneling and candles. Gorgeous and simple. Lobby/common areas: Beautiful too. Everything was simple and elegant. Grounds/pool: Heavenly view of the bay. The pool was warm, the plantings were gorgeous, the sunbeds were comfortable, and the service was attentive without being annoying (and they knew my name after one day). Food/drinks can add up cost-wise though. Rooms: This would be my only critique. The rooms are not as nice as everything else. Although spotlessly clean with comfortable beds, they could use an update. I loved the balcony though. You can not have a bad view at this hotel. My only other small complaint would be about the location. It would be wise to rent a car (but it's expenive to park). The hotel is on an island, and there isn't so much as a convenience store or coffee shop in walking distance. On the flip side it makes for a peaceful and quiet vacation if you want Miami, but don't want to attitude and bustle of South Beach (I love South Beach, but this is a really great alternative). Great for a girls weekend, romantic weekend or to bring your parents.

Reviews.Title: “100% Approval From Hotel Snob”
Reviews.Author: PleasedOhio
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of going to this years Super Bowl and decided to try Grove Isle Hotel and Spa after looking at their website. I am very picky about my hotels and to say I look the rooms over is and understatement. 1. The Staff were wonderful and the front desk person took us on a quick tour when we got there. The valet parking guys were over the top nice and I was impressed when using the elevator that the staff would wait until the next (not that I cared). We did pay a valet fee and tipped several times however, it is clearly stated and the guys were quick and willing to help with directions. 2. The room was extremely clean and I am the type who walk into the bathroom first and look at the floor corners first. I know sounds funny but after seeing 60 Minutes stories about rooms has ruined me. The room was cleaning in the AM and then at night we had turndown service and towels were refreshed again. I guess if I had a complaint it would be the extra resort charge we paid for things like water in the room. Maybe they should include free cookies or something like that. They did have a basket full, refrig full and wet bar of items to purchase (way over priced like everywhere else). 3. Location was out of the way which we liked but easy to find. The little town of Coconut Grove was very close. 4. Pool and bar area are good but to be honest I only used once. Again, if I had a complaint it was no one came over to ask if I wanted a drink but not willing to make a big deal of it. 5. The restaurant Gibraltar. We decided to have dinner there instead of going to Emeril's place after looking at his prices. I want to give some extra points about our dinner. The staff and expecially our waitress were unbelievable. I totally disagree with anyone who does not give them a good rating. We ordered several items from salads, chicken, swordfish and finished with desserts. They brought fabulous breads with two different spreads, two appetizers for us to sample and always filled out glasses not in a pushy way. We decided to try two different desserts even though we were full and let me tell you, the key lime pie was over the top including a topping of shaved white chocolate. They finished the meal with two plated chocolates. We even asked the staff to raise a divider that had been lowered as it was a little windy and they immediately raised it so we could enjoy the view. Bottom line, worth every cent. I would go there again and again but as we are from Ohio, I don't know when we will ge back. I thank the entire hotel for giving us such a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible hotel & worst high-priced restaurant in Miami”
Reviews.Author: evoga
Reviews.Content: How very sad. This hotel used to be a jewel in Miami with a fantastic view on a secluded, yet very convenient, island. I have been coming for over 20 years! New management took over in late 2008, and it's been downhill ever since. Baleen's - the prior restaurant - has been replaced by an ill-conceived Gibraltar sporting "British" club food. Maintenance has been deferred everywhere. Staff is pleasant but poorly trained. Rooms are OK, but far from their prior level of luxury. Most disappointing is the outdoor party space, with a new tan tent top and a sloppily power-washed wood floor. This isn't even a gem-in-the-rough anymore. Just avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “One night wasn't enough!”
Reviews.Author: NEohiotraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and i wanted a quick Christmas cruise get-a-way. We've been burned a few times traveling the same day as the cruise departure day and since it was only for four days we didn't want to waste the first day tired or concerned that our flight would be delayed. We usually stay in South Beach but we wanted something different. American Express offered a great deal on Grove Isle but when we read some of the reviews we were a little concerned. The experience was great! From check-in to check-out the staff was great. The restaurant is brand new - if we understood correctly they just recently brought in new management, menu and chef. Since this was our first time, I can't comment on the past, but our meal was wonderful. I agree however with other previous comments on the automatic gratuity. I don't like having someone decide what the tip should be. It felt a little cheap to have this added to our bill. We loved the outside firepits. It was a beautiful way to spend our evening. While sitting outside the bartender had the restaurant make us a cheese/fruit tray and checked back with us regularly. My only regret was that we didn't even use the spa. You can bet next time we will - there will certainly be a next time!

Reviews.Title: “management cancelled a confirmed reservation”
Reviews.Author: trwGreenacresFlorida
Reviews.Content: We used to love this hotel, we had stayed in the past several times. We loved it so much that we planned to spend our wedding night there. I had made the reservations in April for a January stay. We stopped by the hotel last weekend for lunch, one month before our wedding, and I handed my confirmation print out to the front desk. After much key punching into her computer I was told they "never got the reservation" in spite of the fact that I had a document clearly showing a confirmed reservation. After a time the general manager became involved and we were told that he was going to be unable to honor the confirmation, since a corporate client had booked the entire hotel and no rooms were available. I asked him what he would have done if we showed up on after our ceremony, confirmation in hand, for the night. We were told "he didn't know what he would have done". Throughout the entire process we didn't feel a whiff of remorse, regret, or contrition for their failure to have a room available for a confirmed reservation. There are many fine hotels in this area offering better value and more congenial staff. We will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “this place is like heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: kclk2000
Reviews.Content: cant say enough about how fantastic this hotel/spa is - Wonderful food, wonderful amenities, beautiful scenery- relaxing, relaxing, relaxing, staff fantastic especially Kenneth Tutt -dont miss out on this gem of a vacation spot-rooms out of this world

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent administrative staff caused major trouble with credit card”
Reviews.Author: SurfingRose
Reviews.Content: Having stayed there for a business meeting, this Grove Isle value for the price payed was not enough: Rooms were somehow comfortable (although old AC was quite noisy), views were breathtaking, food was overpriced, restaurant policies made no sense -we sat at Baleen Restaurant and while deciding what to have for dinner someone came along with the Bar Menu (just a few meters away), we asked to be served this menu's food and had a negative answer and when we finally decided to go to have dinner at the bar instead, we were charged over $100 usd for two bottles of water and one cup of wine (none of them was "special")-. On top of all these, there was the credit card incident. While checking in, we had trouble with the corporate card credit limits and gave the personal card instead. But, we specifically asked them to please wait for us to solve the corporate card issues before charging or asking for an authorization. Of course they didn't. And finally the day we were checking out they made an awful mess with both our corporate and personal credit cards. For one of my colleagues, they first double charged her personal credit card and charged nothing to the corporate card. For me they caused my personal card credit to be blocked (so long for my weekend shopping). We spent the next half day (a beautiful, sunny Saturday!) at their offices trying to make them (quite concerned, sweet but incompetent girls) understand what needed to be done and still they messed it up. My colleague ended up with a charge to the corporate card of 150% of the total amount and a credit to her personal card of -50% of the total amount. If you can avoid it: DO NOT STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views; Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: Baldness
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and enjoyed each and every one of them! The rooms were clean, the grounds were well manicured, the views from our balcony were breathtaking, and service was impeccable. We were always greeted with a smile, and anything we needed was provided immediately. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: newengtravelers
Reviews.Content: Positives are great pool and spa area. Work out room is well equipped. Room was nice and all seemed to have balconies. Food was decent and fresh. Negatives. Food and drinks way overpriced. Read a review that said the service was great but that was far from my experience. They have a mini bar in the rooms but also leave a half bottle of wine with an opener out on the table when you walk in. Don't drink it. They charge you $125 and it wasn't very good. I think that practice is deceiving at best and fraudulent at worst. When making the reservation my wife specifically asked if there was construction. She was told one of the bars was being remolded but it wouldn't effect our stay. Our room was filled with exhaust fumes from the equipment. Listened to them slam concrete into the back of a pickup all day yesterday at the pool and the lobby is torn up as well. The jacuzzi heat was turned off yesterday as well. Plenty of other options for this price in Miami area. Don't bother with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled service!”
Reviews.Author: forbusiness
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location....beautiful spot by the water, nice breezes. Great food, and the service is really top notch. Anything you want...with a big smile!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royality”
Reviews.Author: honeymooners912
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Grove ilse was amazing. The service was unbelievably great. We spent part of our honeymoon there. With in minutes of arrive the GM had delivered champange and cheese to our room. The entire staff is incredibly friendly and polite. The hotel itself was beautiful, classy and incredibly clean. The pool area was quiet, with great service at bar. The hotel is right on the water, every view is of the water. At the pool you have a choice of laying by the water, in the sand or by the pool. Our room was a suite and i kept telling my husband that they had the softest sheets i have ever slept on. The food in the resturant was beyond great. We had fresh fish every night. Grove Isle is about 15 min at the most from south beach. It was nice to see the crazyness of south beach and then be able to come back to our hotel. Above all we appreciated the hospitatility of the entire staff. They were always more than willing to suggest good restruants and give us directions to sights we wanted to see. Absolutly beautiful, accomidating and quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis in an urban jungle”
Reviews.Author: Adrian Loveridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two hotels in Coconut Grove (the other being the Ritz Carlton). For location, room, view and ambiance we much preferred the Grove Isle, but it was the little things that need attention. Cold toast at every breakfast, included Champagne that turned out to be a Californian sparkling wine better associated with electrical appliances, having to ask for a second bathrobe and replacement coffee sachets. And perhaps the biggest deterrent (at least for us) were the very high restaurant and outrageous wine prices. $60 for a bottle of French red that could be purchased retail in the amazing Local Market for $10.99. With our package we had a $150 resort credit and frankly it didn't even cover one dinner for two (2 courses) and a bottle of wine which came to $181 including a 20% service charge and tax.

Reviews.Title: “BEST GETAWAY FOR RELAXATION AND AWAY FROM "CLUBBY-MIAMI"”
Reviews.Author: g0ldilocs8
Reviews.Content: So I used Trip Advisor to book my initial stay and was anxious to see if it was everything the CURRENT YEAR'S reviews made it up to...and.... Absolutely yes, yes, yes, book this place - I'm 25, full time grad student, full time employee and was in dire need of sun and relaxation. I was in no rush to be "typically young" on the strip with swimwear on all day among loud music and other young people who came specifically for that (no offense). MY boyfriend and I wanted to be at arms-reach to the "South Beach-ness" if we chose to explore it, and this hotel sold us as being on a separate island...in search for tranquility and peace? Gove Isle Hotel did just that. We stayed in a Junior Suite I believe (the view of the bay was absolutely gorgeous and breathtaking) and from the moment you enter the room you instantly are de-stressed (and it was rainy that day our flight landed and I still instantly fell in love with the room so you know the room had to be nice)... Some of the things you absolutely HAVE to do there: -Watsu Pool: although it was a bit tricky to start the jets inside (but was easily attended to by the staff), the water was clean and very warm! (my boyfriend said the waterfall beating down on his back and shoulders was amazing and took all his kinks in his neck and shoulders out) -Enjoy a nap on the balcony: After a dip in the adult pool and Jacuzzi (adult pool has the bar alongside of it) I went to our room and laid out on the wooden sun chairs and I just so happened to look up to see clear blue skies and felt a breeze that felt incredible from the many palm trees that surrounded our room. So relaxing, I cannot say that enough! -Baleen Restaurant for Breakfast: Sit closest by the bay (inside)...we were inundated with lush tropical plants and blue water, just a sight to see. And do order the crab and roasted pepper omelets, it's a large portion and very tasty. I wouldn't go big over the food in general (sent back my waffle, was too dry) but I have to say the roasted asparagus and potatoes made up for it. Just the presentation itself at the restaurant is an experience. And the prices didn't make me stumble either as said in previous reviews. -Locker Room (Steam Room): with a cold class of lemon and cucumber water ladies? enough said! If you don't rent a car (like we didn't being constant city drivers from DC and wanting a real break) definitely look for Juan, he was the absolute best cabbie-slash-tour guide-slash-hotel employee. He was so helpful in taking us into South Beach, recommending the best places to eat, wine, and shops. I hope I'm not leaving out anything; I wanted to give an honest opinion since I myself used this review to choose (in my humble opinion) a very enjoyable stay. YES INDEED bring a sweater, the room is cold! (but you can adjust the temperature, it will just take awhile), enjoy the spa lotions, shampoos, and soaps provided (saves space in your luggage), and snuggle up in the robe provided! Turn-down service is provided, and our towels were warm! Just enjoy as we did! Great place for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot, great spa, great views... No bargain by any means.”
Reviews.Author: Mnssceg
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. The room was clean, great views of the bay. Attractive decor, beautiful landscaping, but the restaurant is definitely not worth the high prices. You can get just as good a meal, or an even better meal, at many other restaurants, for half the price. We got the spa package for 2 nights, which allowed us 2 couples massages. The spa employees were great, but watch out for them charging you at the end. It was cleared right up, but you just need to make sure you watch the final billing. There are lots of additional fees and charges, so just be aware. We had a good time, but don't know if we would be back again. It isn't a bargain, and I don't think they give anything special for the price.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: yotbot
Reviews.Content: This hotel promises a lot, and with its setting how could you go wrong? Actually, very easily it seems. From the get go there were problems with the service. We had a champagne (aka cheap sparkling wine as it turned out) 'amenity' on our 'Just for two' package supposedly for delivery on arrival. It didn't turn up so after 20 minutes we called the front desk. They said it would be up shortly. Half an hour later we went to the pool 'champagne-less' calling by the desk to request a 7pm delivery instead. This elicited a curt response of 'they are probably dealing with it now' and a most reluctant re-scheduling (our fault of course). The 'champagne' arrived at 7.15 but not until a further phone call. At the pool, no-one bothered to bring us towels or tried to place us. We found loungers and had to fetch our own towels. I've had better service at some motels! The kids referred to by some other reviewers were all too evident. Very romantic touch. Baleen is good and the service attentive, a pity about the mosquitoes. Being bitten 15 times kind of impacts on the sense of romance once again. At check out we were denied the $50 credit that was meant to be applied towards our meal at Baleen and the agent was abrupt in telling us you had to have a two night stay for that. That isn't what the website said when I booked the package but it has now changed. Sadly I hadn't printed out the exact description of the old package when I booked it. Foolish trusting me. Indeed, they also tried to charge us for breakfast (also included in the deal) but I got that reversed as the girl reluctantly conceded that this was 'originally' the case even if it wasn't any more. So it seems that unless you check real carefully and stick your heels in, they'll do their best to rip you off. Let's not mention the maid who insisted on entering the room when she was asked not to (we had a late check out - although we were so irritated we didn't take it up) or the fact that our room was 'turned down' for the night sometime between 5.30pm and 6.20 pm. Huh? I'd also have thought that a DVD player would have been a standard feature in most 'luxury' hotel rooms these days... One would have thought with the ample competition in Miami and with the economy being what it is, that management might have tried a little harder to get the basics right. Ah well...

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience we've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: tenispro8
Reviews.Content: We were told by the front desk manager Alex Cass that there would be no problem extending our stay an extra day if necessary. He told us this since we booked the hotel two months prior. When we did need to extend one day, he told us there would be no problem.
